speaker: Doctor
text: What symptoms have you been experiencing besides rapid breathing and swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling really tired and not wanting to eat much. My legs feel puffy too.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your urine, such as color or frequency?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really noticed anything different about my urine. It seems the same as usual.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent illnesses, infections, or fevers before these symptoms started?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't been sick or had a fever before this. I just started feeling unwell recently.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any abdominal pain or discomfort, particularly in the area where your liver is located?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any tummy aches or pain anywhere. My belly feels okay.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent weight changes, either gaining or losing weight unexpectedly?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really gained or lost any weight that I know of. I just don't feel like eating much lately.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to anyone who has been sick?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled anywhere recently, and I don't know anyone who's been sick. It's just been me at home with my family.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any itching or rashes on your skin?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any itching or rashes on my skin. My skin feels normal.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any history of allergies or any known medical conditions in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any allergies or medical conditions that I know of. I've always been healthy before this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or any specific foods that seem to make you feel worse?

speaker: Patient
text: I've just not been very hungry lately, and I don't really want to eat much of anything. It feels like food doesn't taste good anymore.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any swelling in other parts of your body, such as your face or hands?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any swelling in my face or hands, just in my legs. They feel a bit puffy.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests or liver function tests done? If so, what were the results?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any blood tests or liver function tests done recently. I don't know what those results would be.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any shortness of breath or difficulty breathing when lying down?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any trouble breathing when lying down. It just feels like I'm breathing fast all the time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of liver disease or any genetic conditions that could affect your health?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't know if anyone in my family has liver disease or anything like that. My parents haven't mentioned it to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin color, such as yellowing of your skin or eyes?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any yellowing of my skin or eyes. My skin looks normal to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual bruising or bleeding, such as nosebleeds or easy bruising?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any bruises or nosebleeds. My skin seems fine, and I haven't noticed any bleeding anywhere.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or exposure to any toxins, such as chemicals or drugs?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations, and I haven't been around any chemicals or drugs. Just been at home with my family.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your energy levels, such as feeling more fatigued than usual?

speaker: Patient
text: I've definitely been feeling more tired than usual. I just want to rest and play less than I normally do.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your stool, such as color or consistency?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my stool. It seems the same as it always has been.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to anyone with hepatitis or any known liver infections?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been around anyone with hepatitis or liver infections. I just stay at home with my family.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Liver_Function_Tests

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: {'ALT': '45 U/L', 'AST': '47 U/L', 'Albumin': '4.0 g/dL', 'Total_Bilirubin': '0.8 mg/dL'}

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I still feel really tired and my legs are puffy. I just want to feel better.
